description: Warm up with this Classic Old Fashioned Loaded Potato Soup! Creamy and hearty, it's a family favorite packed with flavor. Don't miss out—try this comforting taste today!
instructions: In a large pot, cook the bacon until crispy. Remove and set aside, leaving the drippings.
Add the chopped onion to the pot and sauté until translucent.
Stir in the diced potatoes and chicken broth. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer until potatoes are tender.
Use a potato masher to mash some of the potatoes for a creamy texture.
Stir in the heavy cream, cheddar cheese, and crumbled bacon. Season with salt and pepper.
tips: For the best flavor, use freshly cooked bacon and high-quality cheese. Adjust the thickness by adding more or less cream.

structured_content.content: This Classic Old Fashioned Loaded Potato Soup is the ultimate comfort food, perfect for chilly days. Its creamy texture and rich flavors make it a family favorite that warms the soul.

note.label: Why You'll Love This Recipe
note.content:
• Quick and easy to make in under 1 hour
  • Hearty and satisfying for the whole family
  • Perfect for weeknight dinners or gatherings
  • Uses simple ingredients you likely have on hand
  • Customizable with your favorite toppings

structured_content.content: I remember making this soup with my family on cold winter nights, gathering around the table to enjoy its warmth and flavor. It's a dish that brings everyone together.

• Main ingredient: Potatoes are the star here; use starchy varieties like Russets for creaminess.
  • Key seasonings/flavoring agents: Salt and pepper enhance the natural flavors; adjust to taste.
  • Supporting ingredients: Bacon adds a smoky flavor, while cheese gives it a rich, creamy finish.
  • Equipment needed: A large pot and a potato masher are essential for this recipe.

upload.context: Preparation of potatoes and other ingredients for the soup.

structured_content.content:
Preparation:
Peel and dice the potatoes, chop the onion, and cook the bacon until crispy.
Cooking Process:
Combine ingredients in a pot, simmer until potatoes are tender, then mash for creaminess.
Finishing Touches:
Stir in cream and cheese, season, and serve garnished with chives.

upload.context: Cooking process showing the soup simmering in the pot.

note.label: You Must Know
note.content:
• Cook the bacon until very crispy for the best texture.
  • Avoid overcooking the potatoes to maintain some chunkiness.
  • When the soup is creamy and heated through, it's ready to serve.
  • Store leftovers in the fridge for up to 3 days; reheat gently.

structured_content.content: This soup is a staple in our home, often shared with friends and family during cozy gatherings. It's a dish that sparks joy and warmth.
Consider adding garlic for extra flavor, or top with sour cream and additional cheese for a richer experience.
Pair this soup with a fresh salad or crusty bread for a complete meal. It's also great with a glass of white wine.
Make it vegetarian by omitting the bacon and using vegetable broth. You can also add broccoli or other vegetables for added nutrition.

upload.context: Final plated dish of the loaded potato soup, garnished and ready to serve.

note.label: Pro Tips
note.content:
• For a smoother soup, blend a portion of it before adding cream.
  • Use freshly grated cheese for better melting.
  • Timing is key; don't rush the simmering process for the best flavor.
  • Garnish with fresh herbs for an impressive presentation.

structured_content.content: Enjoy making this comforting soup that brings warmth and joy to your table. It's a dish that everyone will love!
